utterance: Timothy W Lyons: Okay, well maybe what I'll um, maybe what I'll start by doing before we go around and and do introductions. I know you're you're getting sort of to the business side of all of this. You're all frantic, not frantically, but creatively thinking about who you want to pair or triple with as you think about your proposals and probably you'd rather almost skip this step and find your two people to start thinking about brainstorming about your proposal. So I'm trying to think of some way to use this space to have a good general discussion and report out as we're supposed to do, but also let you start continue to formulate in your minds what you want to do for your proposal. Um, so I want you to do most of the talking, not me. I think it's good to do the introduction because you're still sort of looking for people to partner with. So you need to know what everyone does. Some of you know each other, some of you don't.

Coordination and Decision Practices.explanation: The speaker structures the meeting by outlining the initial process of introductions and setting dual goals for the discussion: general reporting and proposal formulation, while also deciding to do introductions for partnering.
Coordination and Decision Practices.score_justification: The speaker provides explicit goals and effectively coordinates the meeting's structure by linking the process (introductions) to the team's task (partnering for proposals).

Relational Climate.explanation: The speaker expresses empathy by acknowledging the participants' desire to focus on proposal brainstorming and partnering, fostering a supportive and understanding environment.
Relational Climate.score_justification: The speaker's strong acknowledgment of the participants' priorities and desire to facilitate their work fosters trust and a positive climate.

Participation Dynamics.explanation: The speaker explicitly encourages participants to do most of the talking and justifies introductions as a means for them to find partners, thereby facilitating their active involvement.
Participation Dynamics.score_justification: The speaker provides a reasoned approach to facilitate participation by encouraging others to speak and explaining how introductions support team formation and engagement.
